SARS‐CoV‐2, the virus previously known as novel 2019‐coronavirus, causes the disease COVID‐19. It was first discovered following the reports of an outbreak of pneumonia in China, with initial infections linked to a single seafood market.
1 ,
13 Genetic studies have shown its genetic sequence is 82% similar to SARS‐CoV, and 89% similar to bat‐SL‐CoVZC45 and bat‐SL‐CoVZXC21, leading to the postulation that bats served as reservoir host for the new coronavirus’ progenitor.
14 Human transmission is thought to have been facilitated by an animal intermediate host, currently hypothesised to be a pangolin.
